etymology.description: 大(大) (dà, "big; great") + 同(同) (tóng, "same; together") = together being great -> great unity
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 大(大) (dà, "big; great") and 同(同) (tóng, "same; together") conveys the idea of people or communities coming together to achieve a sense of greatness or unity.

examples.chinese: 国家追求大同(國家追求大同)。
examples.english: The nation strives for great unity.

examples.chinese: 游客参观大同(遊客參觀大同)，探寻历史文化(探尋歷史文化)。
examples.pinyin: Yóukè cānguān dàtóng, tànxún lìshǐ wénhuà.
examples.english: Visitors tour Datong to explore its historical culture.
